children.name: according
children.sourceText: O Lord, have mercy; according to thy abundant mercy which thou hast had upon the people of Nephi, have upon me, and my people.

children.name: a
children.sourceText: Surely, this is more than a man.

children.name: above
children.sourceText: Is it above the earth?

children.name: all
children.sourceText: Surely there has not been any servant among all my servants that has been so faithful as this man; for even he doth remember all my commandments to execute them.

children.name: among
children.sourceText: Surely there has not been any servant among all my servants that has been so faithful as this man; for even he doth remember all my commandments to execute them.

children.name: and
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: any
children.sourceText: Surely there has not been any servant among all my servants that has been so faithful as this man; for even he doth remember all my commandments to execute them.

children.name: as
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: at
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: because
children.sourceText: Behold, is not this the Great Spirit who doth send such great punishments upon this people, because of their murders?

children.name: but
children.sourceText: Now I surely know that this is the Great Spirit, and I would desire him that he come in unto me, but I durst not.

children.name: by
children.sourceText: Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks; And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.name: concerning
children.sourceText: Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks; And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.name: down
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: for
children.sourceText: Surely there has not been any servant among all my servants that has been so faithful as this man; for even he doth remember all my commandments to execute them.

children.name: from
children.sourceText: Art thou sent from God?

children.name: he
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: him
children.sourceText: Now I surely know that this is the Great Spirit, and I would desire him that he come in unto me, but I durst not.

children.name: his
children.sourceText: For as sure as thou livest, behold, I have seen my Redeemer; and he shall come forth, and be born of a woman, and he shall redeem all mankind who believe on his name.

children.name: I
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: if
children.sourceText: Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks; And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.name: in
children.sourceText: Now I surely know that this is the Great Spirit, and I would desire him that he come in unto me, but I durst not.

children.name: it
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: may
children.sourceText: But behold, I will go with thee to the land of Middoni; for the king of the land of Middoni, whose name is Antiomno, is a friend unto me; therefore I go to the land of Middoni, that I may flatter the king of the land, and he will cast thy brethren out of prison.

children.name: me
children.sourceText: Now I surely know that this is the Great Spirit, and I would desire him that he come in unto me, but I durst not.

children.name: might
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: my
children.sourceText: Surely there has not been any servant among all my servants that has been so faithful as this man; for even he doth remember all my commandments to execute them.

children.name: neither
children.sourceText: I will not slay Ammon, neither will I return to the land of Ishmael, but I go to the land of Middoni that I may release the brethren of Ammon, for I know that they are just men and holy prophets of the true God.

children.name: nevertheless
children.sourceText: Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks; And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.name: o
children.sourceText: O Lord, have mercy; according to thy abundant mercy which thou hast had upon the people of Nephi, have upon me, and my people.

children.name: of
children.sourceText: Behold, is not this the Great Spirit who doth send such great punishments upon this people, because of their murders?

children.name: off
children.sourceText: Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks; And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.name: on
children.sourceText: For as sure as thou livest, behold, I have seen my Redeemer; and he shall come forth, and be born of a woman, and he shall redeem all mankind who believe on his name.

children.name: our
children.sourceText: Now this is the Great Spirit of whom our fathers have spoken.

children.name: out
children.sourceText: But behold, I will go with thee to the land of Middoni; for the king of the land of Middoni, whose name is Antiomno, is a friend unto me; therefore I go to the land of Middoni, that I may flatter the king of the land, and he will cast thy brethren out of prison.

children.sourceText: For as sure as thou livest, behold, I have seen my Redeemer; and he shall come forth, and be born of a woman, and he shall redeem all mankind who believe on his name.

children.name: than
children.sourceText: Surely, this is more than a man.

children.name: that
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: the
children.sourceText: Behold, is not this the Great Spirit who doth send such great punishments upon this people, because of their murders?

children.name: thee
children.sourceText: Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks; And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.name: them

children.name: there
children.sourceText: Surely there has not been any servant among all my servants that has been so faithful as this man; for even he doth remember all my commandments to execute them.

children.name: therefore
children.sourceText: But behold, I will go with thee to the land of Middoni; for the king of the land of Middoni, whose name is Antiomno, is a friend unto me; therefore I go to the land of Middoni, that I may flatter the king of the land, and he will cast thy brethren out of prison.

children.sourceText: Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks; And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.sourceText: Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks; And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.name: this
children.sourceText: Surely, this is more than a man.

children.name: thou
children.sourceText: Who art thou?

children.name: thy
children.sourceText: Yea, I will believe all thy words.

children.name: to
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren.

children.name: unto
children.sourceText: Now I surely know that this is the Great Spirit, and I would desire him that he come in unto me, but I durst not.

children.sourceText: Behold, is not this the Great Spirit who doth send such great punishments upon this people, because of their murders?

children.name: which
children.sourceText: Yea, I believe that he created all things which are in the earth; but I do not know the heavens.

children.name: who
children.sourceText: Behold, is not this the Great Spirit who doth send such great punishments upon this people, because of their murders?

children.name: whom
children.sourceText: Now this is the Great Spirit of whom our fathers have spoken.
